title: Associate Sales Consultant - Cardio Metabolic Health - Northwest GTA
description: At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world.

raw.title: Associate Sales Consultant - Cardio Metabolic Health - Northwest GTA
raw.excerpt: At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world.
raw.description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. Weâ€™re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Job Summary
We are seeking a highly motivated and resultsâ€‘oriented Sales Consultant to drive the adoption and sales of Eli Lillyâ€™s cardiometabolic health portfolio across Northwest GTA. This role requires strong relationshipâ€‘building with healthcare professionals, deep clinical and scientific understanding, and the ability to execute strategic territory plans that improve patient outcomes.

At Lilly Canada, Sales Consultant positions are structured into three levels based on the candidates experience, background, and qualifications. For transparency, the ranges for this position are:

â€¢ Associate Sales Consultant: $69,000 - $101,200

â€¢ Sales Consultant: $81,000 - $118,800

â€¢ Sr Sales Consultant: $96,000 - $140,800

This role is eligible for additional forms of compensation, such as participation in the Lilly Sales Incentive Program and a company car.

This posting is for an existing vacancy.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute comprehensive territory business plan & territory ownership to achieve and exceed sales targets for cardiometabolic products.
  • Build, cultivate, and sustain strong, credible relationships with family physicians, specialists, pharmacists, nurses, and other healthcare professionals in hospitals, clinics, and community practices.
  • Communicate complex clinical and scientific information effectively, demonstrating strong knowledge of Lillyâ€™s cardiometabolic portfolio, disease states, and therapeutic positioning.
  • Identify customer needs and deliver tailored, valueâ€‘added solutions using a needsâ€‘based customer interaction model and multiâ€‘channel engagement strategies.
  • Demonstrated digital fluency with the ability to leverage omnichannel engagement strategiesâ€”including virtual platforms, CRM systems, and dataâ€‘driven insights toolsâ€”to deliver personalized, highâ€‘impact customer interactions and optimize territory performance.
  • Analyze territory data, market trends, and competitive insights to inform strategy, optimize resource allocation, and maximize performance.
  • Collaborate with crossâ€‘functional teamsâ€”including Marketing, Medical Affairs, Market Access, and internal partnersâ€”to ensure a coordinated customer experience.
  • Manage territory resources and budgets responsibly while adhering to company policies, compliance standards, and ethical guidelines.
  • Maintain accurate customer records and timely documentation through CRM systems such as Veeva.
  • Actively participate in regional and national meetings, training programs, and industry conferences.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Science, Business, or a related field.
  • 3â€“5+ years of successful pharmaceutical sales experience, with a preference for experience in cardiometabolic, diabetes, or related therapeutic areas.
  • Proven track record of achieving or exceeding sales targets in competitive markets.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders.
  • Strong business acumen and analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make sound strategic decisions.
  • Ability to work independently in a fastâ€‘paced environment while contributing effectively to team success.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, CRM systems (e.g., Veeva), and data insights tools (IQVIA, Tableau).
  • Valid driverâ€™s license with a clean driving record; ability to travel throughout the Northwest GTA territory.
  • Knowledge of the Canadian healthcare system and pharmaceutical landscape is an asset.
  • Experience working with specialists and thought leaders is advantageous.

Additional Skills & Attributes

  • Strong digital fluency, including comfort using an iPad as a core daily tool.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop strong customer relationships and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
  • High learning agility, adaptability, and a strong growth mindset.
  • Recognized strengths in leadership, teamwork, and customer focus.
  • Experience engaging regional, & national thought leaders is an asset.

Additional Information

Lilly will conduct a background checkâ€”including verification of educational credentials and reference checksâ€”at its own expense.
Eli Lilly Canada is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from qualified women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, and persons with disabilities.
If your current level aligns with the career band of this role, it may be considered a lateral move. For further information, please contact your HR Business Partner.

Lilly is dedicated to helping individuals with disabilities to actively engage in the workforce, ensuring equal opportunities when vying for positions. If you require accommodation to submit a resume for a position at Lilly, please complete the accommodation request form (https://careers.lilly.com/us/en/workplace-accommodation) for further assistance. Please note this is for individuals to request an accommodation as part of the application process and any other correspondence will not receive a response.

Lilly does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Actual compensation will depend on a candidateâ€™s education, experience, skills, and geographic location. The anticipated wage for this position is

$75,000 - $149,600

Full-time equivalent employees may also be eligible for a company bonus (depending, in part, on company and individual performance). In addition, Lilly offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees, including eligibility to participate in a pension plan; vacation benefits; eligibility for healthcare benefits; flexible benefits (if applicable) life insurance and death benefits; certain time off and leave of absence benefits; and well-being benefits (e.g., employee assistance program, fitness benefits, and employee clubs and activities). Lilly reserves the right to amend, modify, or terminate its compensation and benefit programs in its sole discretion and Lillyâ€™s compensation practices and guidelines will apply regarding the details of any promotion or transfer of Lilly employees.

raw.title: Director, Portfolio Management
raw.excerpt: Job DescriptionIn this role you will be responsible for leading the planning and portfolio management activities.
raw.description:
Job Description

In this role you will be responsible for leading the planning and portfolio management activities. This includes multi-year strategic planning, annual division planning, business segment specific plans, goal setting and planning coordination with other divisions.

Weâ€™re seeking a builder of enterprise EPMOs who can design and operationalize governance, operating models, and portfolio processes that scale across business units and multiâ€‘portfolio environments ($100M+). The ideal leader strengthens portfolio management and multiâ€‘year investment planning, enables clear tradeâ€‘offs and executive decisionâ€‘making, and drives workforce planning to ensure the right capacity, skills, and sourcing models for predictable delivery. They bring handsâ€‘on wins in automation and AI (intake design, business cases, value tracking), coach teams through hybrid/agile/productâ€‘centric transitions, establish vendorâ€‘management strategies (spend visibility and performance), define enterprise prioritization and intake frameworks, and build executiveâ€‘ready dashboards, KPIs/OKRs, and benefitsâ€‘realization metricsâ€”standardizing core practices while preserving smart flexibility.

What You Will Do

  • Facilitate and coordinate with stakeholders across the organization to optimize relationships and ensure understanding of strategy, planning and sequencing components, and performance monitoring components and results
  • Oversee the strategic planning process and organizational reviews, communicating results to top management, and developing strategies based on organizational reviews
  • Oversee and coordinate divisional and annual/enterprise planning and resource needs (e.g., prioritization and sequencing people/shared resources, investments/funding, and/or acquisition of key assets/capabilities) to support divisional goals.
  • Ensure program portfolio composition and sequencing to accurately reflect and enable Market strategy
  • Collaborate with internal teams and other key partners to develop and manage the investment portfolio, including sizing and prioritizing of investments to enable effective execution of the strategic plan and delivering on stated goals.

What You Bring

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree and 10 years of experience with strategic planning, annual planning, and/or performance tracking.
  • If no degree, a minimum of 12 years of experience as listed above.
  • Proven experience building or transforming an enterprise PMO/EPMO, including governance, operating models, and portfolio processes that scale across multiple business units.
  • Demonstrated ability to create enterprise frameworks that strengthen portfolio management, multi-year investment planning, trade-off decisions and executive decision making.
  • Experience designing frameworks that operate effectively across multiâ€‘portfolio environments exceeding $100M.
  • Experience leading enterprise workforce planning to ensure the right capacity, skills, and sourcing models are in place to meet portfolio demand, support strategic priorities, and enable predictable delivery.
  • Handsâ€‘on experience leading automation and AI initiatives, including intake design, business case development, and value tracking.
  • Experience coaching teams through delivery model transitions, such as hybrid, agile, or productâ€‘centric structures.
  • Experience establishing an EPMO vendor management strategy, including spend visibility, performance tracking, and practices that support portfolio delivery.
  • Expertise defining and operationalizing enterprise prioritization and intake frameworks, including scoring models, criteria, thresholds, and crossâ€‘functional facilitation.
  • Strong capability in developing enterprise dashboards, KPIs, OKRs, benefitsâ€‘realization metrics, and executiveâ€‘ready portfolio insights that drive decisionâ€‘making.
  • Demonstrated success driving operating model and process alignment across multiple portfolios, standardizing core practices while enabling flexibility where needed.

Salary Range

At Blue Cross NC, we take great pride in a fair and equitable compensation package that reflects market-price and our starting salaries are typically planned near the middle of the range listed. Compensation decisions are driven by factors including experience and training, specialized skill sets, licensure and certifications and other business and organizational needs. Our base salary is part of a robust Total Rewards package that includes an Annual Incentive Bonus*, 401(k) with employer match, Paid Time Off (PTO), and competitive health benefits and wellness programs.

*Based on annual corporate goal achievement and individual performance.

$173,776.00 - $278,041.00

title: Paid Marketing Program Manager
description: Paid Marketing Program Manager About Kalkomey: Kalkomey Enterprises is the trusted guide to outdoor success.

raw.title: Paid Marketing Program Manager
raw.excerpt: Paid Marketing Program Manager About Kalkomey: Kalkomey Enterprises is the trusted guide to outdoor success.
raw.description:
Paid Marketing Program Manager

About Kalkomey:

Kalkomey Enterprises is the trusted guide to outdoor success. Our platform connects millions of people to the outdoors every year, and we are the leading provider of safety-related education for outdoor recreational activities such as hunting, fishing, boating, snowmobiling, and more across North America. Since our founding in 1995, weâ€™ve expanded to offer over 360 high-quality online educational courses, a suite of integrated web and mobile applications, and resources tailored to ensure outdoor enthusiasts recreate safely and successfully.

Weâ€™re looking for a strategic and highly analytical Paid Marketing Program Manager who can design, execute, and scale multi-channel paid marketing campaigns to drive business growth. The ideal candidate brings a passion for the outdoors paired with proven experience using digital advertising to reach, engage, and convert customers at scale. In this role, youâ€™ll combine deep analytical rigor with creative experimentation to optimize performance across paid social, paid search, display, and emerging digital advertising channels.

You must reside in one of these US states: AZ, CO, FL, IL, IN, KY, MA, MD, MI, MN, NC, NV, OR, PA, RI, TX, VA, VT, WI or one of these provinces in Canada: Ontario

What Youâ€™ll Do:

Campaign Strategy & Execution:

  • Lead end-to-end planning, execution, and optimization of paid media campaigns across channels like Meta, Google, Bing and YouTube.

  • Orchestrate multi-touch campaigns aimed at achieving key marketing objectives and business priorities.

Analytical Leadership:

  • Establish and analyze key performance metrics (CAC, ROAS, LTV, conversion rate) to inform and influence marketing strategy and investment decisions.

  • Build and evolve performance dashboards and reporting frameworks to provide timely insights to both stakeholders and senior leaders.

Experimentation & Optimization:

  • Drive A/B and CRO experimentation across areas like ad creative/copy, landing pages, audiences, and bidding strategies.

  • Leverage data and test results to iterate rapidly and scale impact on the program.

Cross-Channel & Cross-Functional Collaboration:

  • Closely partner with teams like creative, product, data, and content to develop high performing campaigns.

  • Coordinate campaign timelines and deliverables across teams to ensure omni-channel campaigns are properly executed.

Innovation & Channel Expansion:

  • Explore and test new paid channels, technologies, and tactics to expand reach and marketing performance.

  • Act as an internal subject matter expert on paid digital marketing platform changes, trends and best practices.

Performance Culture & Continuous Improvement:

  • Champion a culture of continuous optimization, iterative learning, and knowledge sharing across departments.

  • Ensure forecasts, budgets, and advertising plans align with company goals and business priorities.

What Youâ€™ll Need (Minimum Qualifications):

  • 7+ years of direct ownership of paid digital marketing channels, performance and seven-figure monthly ad budgets.

  • Hands-on experience running campaigns across paid platforms including Meta (Facebook/Instagram), Google Ads, Bing and common Display Networks.

  • Proven track record of driving measurable business growth (revenue, contribution margin) or acquisition efficiency gains (CAC, ROAS).

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to define success metrics, analyze campaign performance, and translate data into clear, actionable insights.

  • Experience with experimentation and A/B testing of ad creative, copy, audiences, bidding strategies, and landing pages.

  • Experience working with marketing and analytics tools such as Google Analytics, AttributionApp, native ad platforms and BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker).

  • Ability to manage multiple campaigns and priorities simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail and performance accountability.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively cross-functionally.

  • Growth mindset with a demonstrated ability to stay current on paid media trends, platform changes, and emerging marketing technologies.

  • Experience working with subscription, education, or consumer digital products is a plus.

Competencies

Campaign Execution Excellence
Owns execution of multi-channel paid media campaigns with attention to detail, optimization, and measurement.

Budget & Vendor Management
Manages paid media budgets and vendor partnerships effectively, ensuring accountability and results.

Audience Targeting & Segmentation
Applies deep knowledge of customer segments to optimize campaign performance and ad spend.

Reporting & Performance Analysis
Generates regular reports and provides actionable insights to improve future campaign effectiveness.

Collaboration & Communication
Partners across creative, product, analytics, and marketing teams to ensure campaign alignment and delivery.

Process & Workflow Management
Improves team efficiency by developing internal workflows, reporting structures, and testing protocols.

Market Awareness
Stays current on trends and competitor strategies in the digital advertising landscape.

Optimization & A/B Testing
Executes testing strategies to iterate and improve ad performance across platforms.

What We Offer:

In addition to a competitive salary and annual bonus, we offer these great benefits:

  • Employer matched 401(k)

  • Medical/Dental/Vision insurance with generous employer contributions (including HSA)

  • Maternity and Paternity leave and benefits

  • 3 weeks paid vacation, 12 paid holidays, a paid community service day, and a flexible work schedule

  • Annual wellness allowance, as well as a paid mental health day once a year for when you need it

  • Automatic WFH contribution to each paycheck

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Kalkomey Enterprises, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Professional certifications (e.g., PE, CEng, PMP) and experience in international or applied projects are an advantage.

Apply â†’ Pass qualification(s) â†’ Join a project â†’ Complete tasks â†’ Get paid

Project time expectations

For this project, tasks are estimated to require around 10â€“20 hours per week during active phases, based on project requirements. This is an estimate, not a guaranteed workload, and applies only while the project is active.

Payment

  • Paid contributions, with rates up to $50/hour*
  • Fixed project rate or individual rates, depending on the project
  • Some projects include incentive payments

raw.description:
The Senior Data Analyst is a subject-matter expert in marketing performance measurement, connecting data to business strategy. This role delivers insights with actionable impact and contributes to the development of analytic frameworks and best practices across clients and industries.

Key Duties/Responsibilities

  • Consult with stakeholders to design robust measurement frameworks that connect online and offline consumer activity.

  • Develop advanced attribution and optimization models to guide marketing investment and strategy.

  • Design and execute complex analyses, test plans, and audience segmentation strategies.

  • Present findings, insights, and recommendations to senior client and business stakeholders.

  • Contribute to the design of scalable analytic processes, templates, and tools.

  • Guide marketing science work including campaign impact measurement, media testing, and reporting automation.

  • Mentor junior analysts and guide analytic design across engagements.

Education

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in a quantitative field

  • Masterâ€™s preferred

Experience

  • 6-8 years of experience in data analytics, marketing science, or strategy

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

  • Strong communication and storytelling with client stakeholders.

  • Able to translate insights across channels and verticals for broad application.

  • Strong understanding of omni-channel measurement techniques and marketing KPIs.

  • Applies knowledge from multiple verticals and multiple channels to identify client opportunities.

  • Experienced in dashboarding, statistical methodologies, and analytical design best practices.

  • Experience with Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Power BI and Tableau or similar visualization tool.

RRD's current salary range for this role is $90,800 to $145,300 / year. The salary range may be adjusted based on the applicable geographic location of the hired employee, and the range may change in the future. At RRD, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions may vary based upon, but not limited to education, skills, experience, proficiency, performance, shift and location. Depending on the role, in addition to base salary, the total compensation package may also include participation in a bonus, commission or incentive program. RRDâ€™s benefit offerings include medical, dental, and vision coverage, paid time off, disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, life insurance and other voluntary supplemental insurance coverages, plus parental leave, adoption assistance, tuition assistance and employer/partner discounts.

All employment offers are contingent upon the successful completion of both a pre-employment background and drug screen.

RRD is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

RRD is a leading global provider of marketing, packaging, print, and supply chain solutions that elevate engagement across the complete customer journey. The company offers the industryâ€™s most trusted portfolio of creative execution and world-wide business process consulting, with services designed to lower environmental impact. With 22,000 clients, including 93% of the Fortune 100, and 32,000 employees across 28 countries, RRD brings the expertise, execution, and scale designed to transform customer touchpoints into meaningful moments of impact

Job Description:

Treatment Design Team Manager

3M Health Care is now Solventum

At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customersâ€™ toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.

We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.

The Impact Youâ€™ll Make on this Role

As a Treatment Design Team Manager, you will lead a large-scale production organization and a team of supervisors, driving operational excellence while developing strong, values-driven leaders. This role requires a leader with a strong sense of urgency, business acumen, and the ability to prioritize, execute, and inspire teams in a fast-paced production environment.

You will make an impact by:

Team Leadership & People Development (Leader of Leaders)

  • Lead, coach, and develop a team of supervisors responsible for large production teams (70+ team members).
  • Build leadership capability through intentional coaching, feedback, and performance management, ensuring supervisors are effective people leaders, not just task managers.
  • Set clear expectations, goals, and accountability frameworks aligned with business priorities and Solventum values.
  • Foster a culture of psychological safety, open communication, and continuous feedback, where teams feel safe to speak up and grow.
  • Conduct regular performance reviews, talent assessments, succession planning, and recognition initiatives.
  • Facilitate leadership forums and meetings to drive alignment, engagement, and execution.

Operational Excellence & Business Execution

  • Own operational performance for orthodontic/dental digital treatment production, including productivity, cycle time, quality, and SLA compliance.
  • Establish strong prioritization practices to ensure urgent business needs are addressed with speed and accuracy.
  • Monitor and analyze performance metrics daily; take decisive and timely action to correct risks or gaps.
  • Ensure standardized processes are consistently followed while identifying opportunities to improve efficiency and throughput.
  • Balance short-term execution with long-term operational sustainability.
  • Support and lead special initiatives or critical business projects as assigned by senior leadership.

Cross-Functional & Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Partner closely with global cross-functional teams (Sales, CST, Manufacturing, Quality, Training) to align service delivery and business objectives.
  • Act as a key point of escalation and decision-making, ensuring issues are resolved with urgency and clarity.
  • Communicate clearly and confidently with senior stakeholders, providing updates, insights, and recommendations based on data.
  • Establish regular stakeholder cadences to ensure transparency and alignment.

Customer & Escalation Management

  • Lead and manage high-impact escalations related to treatment design, quality, or delivery timelines.
  • Communicate effectively with customers (dentists, orthodontists) when needed, ensuring resolution, trust, and satisfaction.

Continuous Improvement & Strategic Thinking

  • Drive a culture of continuous improvement, encouraging leaders and teams to identify inefficiencies and propose solutions.
  • Leverage data, Lean/CI methodologies, and best practices to improve workflows, capacity planning, and team performance.
  • Translate business strategy into actionable execution plans for leaders and teams.
  • Actively support change management initiatives and organizational transformation efforts.

Training, Compliance & Governance

  • Partner with Training teams to ensure effective onboarding and leadership readiness for new supervisors.
  • Ensure compliance with regulatory, quality, and industry standards.
  • Promote consistency, governance, and accountability across all teams.

Data-Driven Leadership

  • Use dashboards, KPIs, and performance data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
  • Present insights and recommendations to senior leadership with clarity and confidence.
  • Drive decisions rooted in data, balanced with strong people judgment.

Qualifications & Experience

Education

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Orthodontics, Dental Technology, Healthcare Management, Industrial Engineering, Production Management, or related field.
  • Advanced degree preferred.

Experience

  • 5+ years of experience leading large-scale production teams, including managing supervisors and leaders.
  • Advanced English C1
  • Proven experience driving performance in high-volume, fast-paced operational environments.
  • Strong background in coaching leaders, performance management, and talent development.
  • Experience managing remote or distributed teams.
  • Demonstrated success in quality assurance, process optimization, and operational execution.

Technical & Business Expertise

  • Familiarity with digital orthodontic workflows, CAD/CAM environments, or virtual production systems.
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); data analysis skills required.
  • Experience leveraging dashboards and metrics to manage performance.

Key Competencies

  • Leadership & Coaching Excellence: Ability to develop strong leaders and hold them accountable.
  • Business Acumen & Sense of Urgency: Prioritizes what matters most and executes decisively.
  • Communication & Emotional Intelligence: Clear, respectful, and impactful communicator.
  • Decision-Making & Problem Solving: Data-driven, pragmatic, and action-oriented.
  • Execution & Organization: Manages complexity, competing priorities, and tight deadlines effectively.
  • Change Leadership: Comfortable leading teams through transformation and continuous improvement.

Work location:

  • Hybrid Eligible

Travel: N/A

Relocation Assistance: N/A

Must be legally authorized to work in the country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

Supporting Your Well-being

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life â€“ both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

raw.description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and your family, be your true self, and live a full life. Youâ€™ll also have access to:

  • Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.
  • Employees can qualify for free medical coverage in our Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO medical plan in the next calendar year.
  • An excellent retirement savings plan with a high employer contribution Â·
  • Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program, and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelorâ€™s degree.
  • A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries worldwide and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
  • A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as the best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

The Opportunity

This position is a field-based position based in Medford, OR in the Cardiac Rhythm Management division. As a global leader in Cardiac Rhythm Technologies, we focus on innovative technologies that can improve the way doctors treat people with heart arrhythmias or irregular heartbeats.

What Youâ€™ll Work On

Under general direction, the CRM Product Support Specialist provides comprehensive engineering, sales, educational, and technical support. This role responds to field inquiries from physicians, healthcare professionals, patients, and field sales staff regarding CRM (Cardiac Rhythm Management) products.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Clinical Interface: Acts as a clinical interface between the medical community and the business.
  • Relationship Building: Demonstrates the ability to build and sustain credible business relationships with customers and share product expertise accordingly.
  • Comprehensive Support: Provides engineering, sales, education, and clinical support in response to field inquiries on an as-needed basis. Demonstrates a thorough command of all CRM products, related product and technical knowledge, trends, and players.
  • Training and Education: Develops, leads, and/or facilitates training sessions and other programs on CRM products for healthcare professionals.
  • Sales Support: Provides additional back-up support to CRM Sales Representatives.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Bio-Medical Engineering, related field or equivalent healthcare experience.
  • A minimum of 2+ years of related experience or a program certification from an accredited cardiac training program.
  • Must have the capability to obtain certification in CRM products.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of cardiology, electro-physiology, or cardiac electro-physiology procedures.
  • Familiarity with cath lab and operating room procedures and protocol
  • Demonstrate advanced knowledge of cardiac pacing systems.
  • Must apply engineering skills and abilities to interpret and solve complex clinical problems.
  • Must possess strong written and verbal communication skills, along with excellent interpersonal, presentation, analytical, and organizational abilities. Additionally, must be able to meet deadlines effectively.
  • Must be detail-oriented and capable of working independently.
  • Must be able to collaborate effectively with engineers, technical specialists, vendors, and customers to achieve assigned goals. Additionally, must be capable of managing multiple assignments simultaneously and efficiently.
  • Must have extensive personal computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office or equivalent software, for tasks such as graphics, word processing, databases, and authoring programs, to develop presentation materials.

Apply Now

Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews.

raw.title: Business Analyst
raw.excerpt: JOB OVERVIEW:This position is responsible for analyzing business performance to support/develop or test the strategic initiatives of customer management, product/business development, productivity optimization, and sales.
raw.description:
JOB OVERVIEW:

This position is responsible for analyzing business performance to support/develop or test the strategic initiatives of customer management, product/business development, productivity optimization, and sales. They must possess excellent interpersonal skills and work well under tight time constraints.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES (Please include % of time for each responsibility):

20%

Information Acquisition â€“ compiles information necessary to review and report on performance of the division, vendors or customers using the Data Warehouse, Operating Systems, External Resources and/or other Resources as required

30%

Analysis, Reporting & Recommendations â€“ uses database programs (e.g., Access) spreadsheets, and other statistical and presentation software to analyze acquired information evaluating the performance of customers, developing pricing strategies, establishing performance patterns. Some of the analysis may be periodic in nature (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) and others may be ad hoc â€“ develops reports and presentations to communicate results and recommends business tactics and strategies based on findings.

30%

RFP Submissions/Contracts â€“ Review and submission of RFPs. Use of database for tracking and follow-up procedures. Working with Legal, Upper Management and Merchandise group troubleshooting issues and preparing documentation related to specific RFP requirements.

15%

Departmental Documentation â€“ prepares and maintains updated documentation on department procedures.

5%

Participates in special projects and performs other duties as required.

SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:

  • Excellent organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills.

  • Self-starter with attention to detail and deadlines.

  • Mathematical aptitude and the ability to formulate pricing guidelines.

  • Advanced Excel and IS knowledge needed.

GENERAL SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:

  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize work

  • Ability to set clear team goals, delegate tasks and set deadlines

  • Very good attention to detail and accuracy

  • Customer service oriented and ability to work with and resolve complex issues

  • Ability to plan and arrange activities

  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to maintain confidential and highly sensitive information

  • Ability to work in a team environment

  • Ability to multi-task

  • Ability to manage conflict

  • Capacity to work effectively under pressure

  • Good analysis and problem-solving skills

  • Oversee multiple and/or complex projects

  • Identify and recommend continuous improvement opportunities

  • Establish productive working relationships at multiple levels within the organization

MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE:

Typically, 5 or more years of related experience.

PREFERRED EDUCATION:

Typically a Bachelor's Degree or global equivalent in related discipline.

TRAVEL / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Travel typically less than 10%. Office environment. No special physical demands required.

The posted range for this position is $56,351 to $77,483which is the expected starting base salary range for an employee who is new to the role to fully proficient in the role. Many factors go into determining employee pay within the posted range including prior experience, current skills, location/labor market, internal equity, etc.

Other benefits available include Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage, 401K Plan with Company Match, PTO [or sick leave if applicable], Paid Parental Leave, Income Protection, Work Life Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, Educational Benefits, Worldwide Scholarship Program and Volunteering Opportunities.
